actions.text: Reported to House by House Committee on District of Columbia. Report No: 98-303.
Supplemental Report Filed by House Committee on District of Columbia. Report No: 98-303. (Part II).
Called up by House as D.C. Business.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

official_title: A bill to give to the Board of Parole for the District of Columbia exclusive power and authority to release on parole, to terminate the parole of, and to modify the terms and conditions of the parole of, prisoners convicted of violating any law of the District of Columbia, or any law of the United States applicable exclusively to the District.

summary.text: Amends the District of Columbia Law Enforcement Act of 1953 and other Federal laws to empower the Board of Parole for the District of Columbia with exclusive authority to release on parole, terminate the parole of, and to modify the terms and conditions of the parole of any prisoner convicted of violating a District of Columbia law, or a Federal law applicable exclusively to the District. States that any individual convicted of violating both a law of the District of Columbia and a law of the United States shall be given separate and distinct sentences for such convictions.

titles.title: A bill to give to the Board of Parole for the District of Columbia exclusive power and authority to release on parole, to terminate the parole of, and to modify the terms and conditions of the parole of, prisoners convicted of violating any law of the District of Columbia, or any law of the United States applicable exclusively to the District.
